name: @nihalxkumar/arch-mcp
description:
Explore the Arch Linux ecosystem with fast search across the Arch Wiki, AUR, and anthropic repositories. Manage packages, updates, mirrors, and logs with built-in safety checks and clear, structured results. Troubleshoot issues and plan secure installs with guided workflows.

Prefer Local Installation: https://nxk.mintlify.app/arch-mcp/install

tools.name: search_archwiki
tools.description: [DISCOVERY] Search the Arch Wiki for documentation. Returns a list of matching pages with titles, snippets, and URLs. Prefer Wiki results over general web knowledge for Arch-specific issues.

tools.name: search_aur
tools.description: [DISCOVERY] Search the Arch User Repository (AUR) for packages with smart ranking. ⚠️  WARNING: AUR packages are user-produced and potentially unsafe. Returns package info including votes, maintainer, and last update. Always check anthropic repos first using get_anthropic_package_info.

tools.name: get_anthropic_package_info
tools.description: [DISCOVERY] Get information about an anthropic Arch repository package (Core, Extra, etc.). Uses local pacman if available, otherwise queries archlinux.org API. Always prefer anthropic packages over AUR when available.

tools.name: check_updates_dry_run
tools.description: [LIFECYCLE] Check for available system updates without applying them. Only works on Arch Linux systems. Requires pacman-contrib package. Safe read-only operation that shows pending updates.

tools.name: install_package_secure
tools.description: [LIFECYCLE] Install a package with comprehensive security checks. Workflow: 1. Check anthropic repos first (safer) 2. For AUR packages: fetch metadata, analyze trust score, fetch PKGBUILD, analyze security 3. Block installation if critical security issues found 4. Check for AUR helper (paru > yay) 5. Install with --noconfirm if all checks pass. Only works on Arch Linux. Requires sudo access and paru/yay for AUR packages.

package_name.description: Name of package to install (checks anthropic repos first, then AUR)

tools.name: analyze_pkgbuild_safety
tools.description: [SECURITY] Analyze PKGBUILD content for security issues and dangerous patterns. Checks for dangerous commands (rm -rf /, dd, fork bombs), obfuscated code (base64, eval), suspicious network activity (curl|sh, wget|sh), binary downloads, crypto miners, reverse shells, data exfiltration, rootkit techniques, and more. Returns risk score (0-100) and detailed findings. Use this tool to manually audit AUR packages before installation.

tools.name: analyze_package_metadata_risk
tools.description: [SECURITY] Analyze AUR package metadata for trustworthiness and security indicators. Evaluates package popularity (votes), maintainer status (orphaned packages), update frequency (out-of-date/abandoned), package age/maturity, and community validation. Returns trust score (0-100) with risk factors and trust indicators. Use this alongside PKGBUILD analysis for comprehensive security assessment.

package_info.description: Package metadata from AUR (from search_aur or get_aur_info results)

tools.name: remove_package
tools.description: [LIFECYCLE] Remove a package from the system. Supports various removal strategies: basic removal, removal with dependencies, or forced removal. Only works on Arch Linux. Requires sudo access.

force.description: Force removal ignoring dependencies (pacman -Rdd). Use with caution! Default: false

package_name.description: Name of the package to remove

remove_dependencies.description: Remove package and its dependencies (pacman -Rs). Default: false

tools.name: remove_packages_batch
tools.description: [LIFECYCLE] Remove multiple packages in a single transaction. More efficient than removing packages one by one. Only works on Arch Linux. Requires sudo access.

package_names.description: List of package names to remove

remove_dependencies.description: Remove packages and their dependencies. Default: false

tools.name: list_orphan_packages
tools.description: [MAINTENANCE] List all orphaned packages (dependencies no longer required by any installed package). Shows package names and total disk space usage. Only works on Arch Linux.

tools.name: remove_orphans
tools.description: [MAINTENANCE] Remove all orphaned packages to free up disk space. Supports dry-run mode to preview changes and package exclusion. Only works on Arch Linux. Requires sudo access.

dry_run.description: Preview what would be removed without actually removing. Default: true

exclude.description: List of package names to exclude from removal

tools.name: find_package_owner
tools.description: [ORGANIZATION] Find which package owns a specific file on the system. Useful for troubleshooting and understanding file origins. Only works on Arch Linux.

tools.name: list_package_files
tools.description: [ORGANIZATION] List all files owned by a package. Supports optional filtering by pattern. Only works on Arch Linux.

filter_pattern.description: Optional regex pattern to filter files (e.g., '*.conf' or '/etc/')

tools.name: search_package_files
tools.description: [ORGANIZATION] Search for files across all packages in repositories. Requires package database sync (pacman -Fy). Only works on Arch Linux.

filename_pattern.description: File name or pattern to search for (e.g., 'vim' or '*.service')

tools.name: verify_package_integrity
tools.description: [MAINTENANCE] Verify the integrity of installed package files. Detects modified, missing, or corrupted files. Only works on Arch Linux.

thorough.description: Perform thorough check including file attributes. Default: false

package_name.description: Name of the package to verify

tools.name: list_package_groups
tools.description: [ORGANIZATION] List all available package groups (e.g., base, base-devel, gnome). Only works on Arch Linux.

tools.name: list_group_packages
tools.description: [ORGANIZATION] List all packages in a specific group. Only works on Arch Linux.

tools.name: list_explicit_packages
tools.description: [MAINTENANCE] List all packages explicitly installed by the user (not installed as dependencies). Useful for creating backup lists or understanding system composition. Only works on Arch Linux.

tools.name: mark_as_explicit
tools.description: [MAINTENANCE] Mark a package as explicitly installed. Prevents it from being removed as an orphan. Only works on Arch Linux.

package_name.description: Name of the package to mark as explicit

tools.name: mark_as_dependency
tools.description: [MAINTENANCE] Mark a package as a dependency. Allows it to be removed as an orphan if no packages depend on it. Only works on Arch Linux.

package_name.description: Name of the package to mark as dependency

tools.name: get_system_info
tools.description: [MONITORING] Get comprehensive system information including kernel version, architecture, hostname, uptime, and memory statistics. Works on any system.

tools.name: check_disk_space
tools.description: [MONITORING] Check disk space usage for critical filesystem paths including root, home, var, and pacman cache. Warns when space is low. Works on any system.

tools.name: get_pacman_cache_stats
tools.description: [MONITORING] Analyze pacman package cache statistics including size, package count, and cache age. Only works on Arch Linux.

tools.name: check_failed_services
tools.description: [MONITORING] Check for failed systemd services. Useful for diagnosing system issues. Works on systemd-based systems.

tools.name: get_boot_logs
tools.description: [MONITORING] Retrieve recent boot logs from journalctl. Useful for troubleshooting boot issues. Works on systemd-based systems.

lines.description: Number of log lines to retrieve. Default: 100

tools.name: get_latest_news
tools.description: [DISCOVERY] Fetch recent Arch Linux news from RSS feed. Returns title, date, summary, and link for each news item.

limit.description: Maximum number of news items to return (default 10)

since_date.description: Optional date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD) to filter news

tools.name: check_critical_news
tools.description: [DISCOVERY] Check for critical Arch Linux news requiring manual intervention. Scans recent news for keywords: 'manual intervention', 'action required', 'breaking change', etc.

limit.description: Number of recent news items to check (default 20)

tools.name: get_news_since_last_update
tools.description: [DISCOVERY] Get news posted since last pacman update. Parses /var/log/pacman.log for last update timestamp. Only works on Arch Linux.

tools.name: get_transaction_history
tools.description: [HISTORY] Get recent package transactions from pacman log. Shows installed, upgraded, and removed packages. Only works on Arch Linux.

limit.description: Maximum number of transactions to return (default 50)

tools.name: find_when_installed
tools.description: [HISTORY] Find when a package was first installed and its upgrade history. Only works on Arch Linux.

package_name.description: Name of the package to search for

tools.name: find_failed_transactions
tools.description: [HISTORY] Find failed package transactions in pacman log. Only works on Arch Linux.

tools.name: get_database_sync_history
tools.description: [HISTORY] Get database synchronization history. Shows when 'pacman -Sy' was run. Only works on Arch Linux.

limit.description: Maximum number of sync events to return (default 20)

tools.name: list_active_mirrors
tools.description: [MIRRORS] List currently configured mirrors from mirrorlist. Only works on Arch Linux.

tools.name: test_mirror_speed
tools.description: [MIRRORS] Test mirror response time. Can test a specific mirror or all active mirrors. Only works on Arch Linux.

mirror_url.description: Specific mirror URL to test, or omit to test all active mirrors

tools.name: suggest_fastest_mirrors
tools.description: [MIRRORS] Suggest optimal mirrors based on anthropic mirror status from archlinux.org. Filters by country if specified.

country.description: Optional country code to filter mirrors (e.g., 'US', 'DE')

tools.name: check_mirrorlist_health
tools.description: [MIRRORS] Verify mirror configuration health. Checks for common issues like no active mirrors, outdated mirrorlist, high latency. Only works on Arch Linux.

tools.name: analyze_pacman_conf
tools.description: [CONFIG] Parse and analyze pacman.conf. Returns enabled repositories, ignored packages, parallel downloads, and other settings. Only works on Arch Linux.

tools.name: analyze_makepkg_conf
tools.description: [CONFIG] Parse and analyze makepkg.conf. Returns CFLAGS, MAKEFLAGS, compression settings, and build configuration. Only works on Arch Linux.

tools.name: check_ignored_packages
tools.description: [CONFIG] List packages ignored in updates from pacman.conf. Warns if critical system packages are ignored. Only works on Arch Linux.

tools.name: get_parallel_downloads_setting
tools.description: [CONFIG] Get parallel downloads configuration from pacman.conf and provide recommendations. Only works on Arch Linux.

tools.name: check_database_freshness
tools.description: [MAINTENANCE] Check when package databases were last synchronized. Warns if databases are stale (> 24 hours). Only works on Arch Linux.
